title: Champion reigns in drenched Brazil to keep title hopes alive
content:
Hamilton sprays Rosberg with champagne on the podium after the Briton’s win at Interlagos Nelson Almeida/AFP/Getty Images
Lewis Hamilton may yet lose his title to his Mercedes team-mate, but a chaotic Brazilian Grand Prix proved beyond doubt the extraordinary superiority of a great world champion.
The elements threw the lot at him yesterday, yet he emerged as though he was on a Sunday-afternoon drive to the shops, an eternity in class ahead of Nico Rosberg, the man who would be king this season. “One of the easiest,” Hamilton said with a wide smile.
Hamilton had to win and did in a race that was stopped twice and went through five safety car periods as the rain drenched Interlagos and turned the Brazilian Grand Prix into a thrilling lottery — at least a lottery for those without Hamilton’s sublime skills.
Hamilton kept his cool on a testing day for the drivers NACHO DOCE/REUTERS
Here we were…
author: ['Kevin Eason', 'Motor Racing Correspondent', 'Sao Paulo']
pageTitle: Champion reigns in drenched Brazil to keep title hopes alive | Sport | The Times & The Sunday Times
